channel.title: [Help] What VPS should i get for my server? [Specs]
channel.description:
Hello everyone. Where should i go to get a VPS, that can hold my runescape private server? Like what website? Also, what do i need? How much RAM, Storage, and all that stuff? ( I do not expect the server to hit more than 20 people by the way.)
Thank you.
Also, how do i setup my private server on a VPS? Does the VPS autoportforward and all? Or what do i do?

item.title: [Help] What VPS should i get for my server? [Specs]

item.description:
@Ajdakiwii wrote:

[quote=“iCreatedHorror, post:5, topic:392300”]vpsland is a horrible choice from what I have heard.
And try looking around the thread about VPS questions for anything useful.[/quote]

VPSLand is fine for a small server like his, It would be stupid paying for a large VPS until you have a stable playerbase

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] What VPS should i get for my server? [Specs]
item.dc:creator: @Ajdakiwii Ajdakiwii
item.description:
@Ajdakiwii wrote:

My server held 15 with very minor lagg with their 19$ VPS

After purchase it takes 24 hours for the VPS to propagate then they will send you the information to connect via Remote Desktop Connection

You use whatever port your server listens to. So if your server uses 5565, You will ask them to open 5565

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Blankk Blankk
item.description:
@Blankk wrote:

okay. thank you for the help.

and they give me an ip as well? and what port would i use? 43594?

how much would a small server be for 20 people?

Read full topic
item.source: [Help] What VPS should i get for my server? [Specs]

item.title: [Help] What VPS should i get for my server? [Specs]
item.dc:creator: @Ajdakiwii Ajdakiwii
item.description:
@Ajdakiwii wrote:

Jaguarpc – 27 Sep 17

VPSLand Merges with JaguarPC - Jaguarpc

What You Can Expect During the Transition First and foremost, all of your servers will remain untouched and online. The merger between VPSLand and JaguarPC will only affect the billing side of your VPSLand account. Instead of logging in at VPSLand,...

They have cheap VPS with windows and linux. http://frantech.ca usually have some but most of the time all sold out

You ask them to open the required ports usually by contacting support

Specs are based on How much players you have, if you have a small amount get a small server

Read full topic
